site_details: Referral from primary care provider

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides a comprehensive special education program for students with disabilities in Dubois, Perry, Pike, or Spencer County. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 3-21 years-old -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Age 6 months and older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Dubois County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the Dubois County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Screening: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours. --
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Dubois County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Dubois County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups. Application process is open all year. Applications can be picked up at the ReStore location, 4232 South 170 East, Huntington.
site_details: Call or visit website to learn about application process and requirements. -- Housing applications can be picked up at the ReStore location, 4232 South 170 East, Huntington.
site_schedule: Varies; depends on current construction project
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Below 60% of the combined median household income based (see website for current income guidelines) -- Able to pay approximately $450 a month with a zero-percent annual percentage rate mortgage -- Have no judgement or collections, or ability to resolve judgements or collections -- Have not had a bankruptcy, or the filing was discharged more than two years ago -- Have been employed two years in the same field and have had no more than one job change in the past 24 months

service_description: Provides home maintenance and repairs for those who cannot perform or afford them. Available services may include house painting, wheelchair ramp construction, and repairs necessary to resident safety.
site_details: Call for information; leave voicemail with name, phone number, and type of maintenance or repair needed.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Below 60% of the combined median household income for Dubois County -- Own and live in home in need of repair -- Have homeowner's insurance coverage -- Be up to date on mortgage and property tax payments -- Agree to partner with HFH in all aspects of the repair project

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Dubois County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING DIRECT HOME LOANS - JASPER AREA OFFICE
service_description: Provides loans to rural homeowners with low to very-low-income to purchase, repair or improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. Qualified repairs may include new roof, siding, or windows, new septic system or furnace/AC, or new kitchen cabinets. Interest rate is contingent on applicant's income.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in  Clay, Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Gibson, Greene, Harrison, Knox, Martin, Monroe, Orange, Owen, Perry, Pike, Posey, Spencer, Sullivan, Vanderburgh, Vigo, Warrick, or Washington County-- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 17
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Provides up to $100 in financial assistance, when available, to assist with utility and rent payments. Clients also receive one-on-one budgeting assistance as well as referrals to other community organizations. Participants are asked to return to TRI-CAP on a quarterly basis, for a period of one year, to continue family development.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Willing to return to TRI-CAP on a quarterly basis, for a period of one year, to continue family development.

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Offers individual development savings accounts for low-income adults. Participants receive matching funds for money they save toward buying or rehabilitating a home, paying for post-secondary education, or starting or expanding a small business. Participants may also use funds for a vehicle purchase to obtain or maintain employment or education. Participants attend financial literacy workshops and assistance developing short- and long-term savings goals.
site_details: Call for enrollment information.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- At or below 200% Federal Poverty Income Guidelines

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Provides a preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at centers in Dubois, Pike, and Warrick County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations. -- Applicants may be placed on a waiting list; those with the greatest needs will be served first.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Ages 3-5 years -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI) -- other special   circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Provides reproductive health care for men and women. Services include short- and long-term birth control supplies (IUD's and implants), pregnancy testing, and general health education. Counseling, testing, and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections and HIV are also offered.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Assists low-income households to increase their homes' energy efficiency in order to reduce their energy costs and protect their health and safety. Services may include conducting an energy audit, installing insulation, caulking leaks, and repairing or replacing faulty heating units.
site_details: Call to apply or for additional information.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Living in the home (either as an owner or a renter) -- Household income up to 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Have or willing to apply for energy assistance program (EAP)

service_description: Sells donated gently used clothing, small appliances, and other household items at discounted prices. Open service area.

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an assistance program for victims of domestic, sexual, and teen dating violence, stalking, and human trafficking. A batterers' intervention program for men and women is also available.
service_name: DOMESTIC, SEXUAL, AND TEEN DATING VIOLENCE SERVICES
service_description: Provides confidential victim assistance and crisis response to male and female victims of domestic, sexual, or teen dating violence. Services include safety planning, court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. Transportation to regional domestic violence shelters and other safe housing options may also be offered. Healthy relationship skills and non-violent family education, prevention, and support are also provided.
site_details: Call for information, or to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule:
Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm; by appointment only
Crisis Hotline: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic, sexual, or teen dating violence

service_description: Provides an educational program for those with problems of violent or abusive behavior, including perpetrators of domestic abuse and/or child abuse. Male-only and female-only classes are available. This program is certified by the Indiana Coalition Against Domestic Violence (ICADV).
site_details: Call for information, or to enroll in classes.
site_schedule:
Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
Classes: Varies; call for schedule; by appointment only
site_eligibility: Age 17 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an assistance program for victims of domestic, sexual, and teen dating violence, stalking, and human trafficking. A batterers' intervention program for men and women is also available.
